articles.author: Petrana Radulovic
articles.title: Netflix’s magic coming-of-age show The Imperfects has a new trailer
articles.description: The Imperfects hits Netflix later this year. It follows three twenty-somethings manifesting weird powers after unethical science experiments.
articles.content: This time, its unethical science experiments!

articles.author: Katharine Lang
articles.title: Are humans 'wired' to hate, and if so, why?
articles.description: Are humans 'set up' to hate, and if so why? In this feature, we investigate the neuroscience and psychology of hate, and potential ways to prevent it.
articles.content: Hate is a powerful negative emotion, but a word that is easy to say. For example, many of us profess to hate public figures, such as politicians. One has only to browse social media to find declarati… [+8039 chars]

articles.author: Brenna Owen
articles.title: Last summer’s B.C., Alberta heat wave was among most extreme since 1960s, study shows
articles.description: The study published in the journal Science Advances found just five other heat waves since the 1960s were more extreme, based on how far they surpassed average summertime heat over the previous 10 years
articles.content:
People cool off in the frigid Lynn Creek water in North Vancouver, B.C., on June 28, 2021.DARRYL DYCK/The Canadian Press

articles.title: Opening up a physics simulator for robotics
articles.description: As part of DeepMind's mission of advancing science, we have acquired the MuJoCo physics simulator and are making it freely available for everyone, to support research everywhere.

articles.author: Nadia Drake
articles.title: How these feuding map-makers shaped our fascination with Mars
articles.description: One was an artist who loved space. His rival was a bold professional astronomer. Their race to map the red planet sparked decades of science and speculation.

articles.title: Episode 3: Why War Zones Need Science Too
articles.description: Undaunted by Yemen’s civil war, National Geographic explorer Ella Al-Shamahi searches on the island of Socotra for traces of the earliest known humans to leave Africa.
